result.execSummary:
The defendant Cierra Shamika McCloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

Concurrent to Counts 2 and 4 and consecutive to  21CF5123, 21CF3840 and 21CF524.
Credit given for 11 days time served on Count 1.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 2 years.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
-Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
-Complete a parenting class.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant is informed she may not possess any firearms or body armor.
- Defendant is informed she may not vote in any elections until her civil rights have been reinstated.
Concurrent to Counts 1 and 4 and consecutive to  21CF5123, 21CF3840 and 21CF524.

All mandatory court costs to be paid during the extended supervision time in Count 1.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.
Concurrent to Counts 1 and 2 and consecutive to 21CF5123, 21CF3840, 21cf524.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cierra Shamika McCloud in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 4:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNTS 3 and 5: Per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered Counts 3 and 5 dismissed and read in.



  Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS concurrent to Counts 2 and 4 and consecutive to  21CF5123, 21CF3840 and 21CF524.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR .

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS concurrent to Counts 1 and 4 and consecutive to  21CF5123, 21CF3840 and 21CF524.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR .

AS TO COUNT 4: 
Defendant is sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent to Counts 1 and 2 and consecutive to 21CF5123, 21CF3840, 21cf524.
All mandatory court costs to be paid during the extended supervision time in Count 1.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgmetn being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-obtain GED/HSED;
-mental health assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department;
-complete Batterer's Intervention Program;
-complete a parenting class;
-no contact with C.D.

Defendant is informed she may not possess any firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed she may not vote in any elections until her civil rights have been reinstated.
-
Credit given for 11 days time served  on Count 1.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 2 years.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant. -- gmb

4/21/2022

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Cierra Shamika McCloud in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with CD, 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Cierra Shamika McCloud in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
